description: This is a special version of UniqueValue Renderer, which loads uniqueValue infos from a style definition.
title: UniqueValueFromStyle Renderer

$eref.description: Symbol3D is the base class for all 3D symbols. It is used to render 2D Point, Polyline, and Polygon features in a FeatureLayer and 3D mesh features in a SceneLayer. All 3D symbols must be used in a SceneView instance; there is no support for 3D rendering in MapViews.
$eref.title: Symbol3D

___defaultSymbol.description: The defaultSymbol on the renderer that get assigned to features with no value or features that do not fall within the configured data.

___defaultLabel.description: Default string for the default symbol used to draw unspecified values.

___type.description: Specifies the type of renderer used.

___styleUrl.description: URL that points to the web style definition. Can not be used in conjunction with styleName.

___visualVariables.description: An array of visualVariable objects used for continuous color or size, simple, and unique values with feature opacity.

$eref.description: An object used to set rendering options. Please see the individual visual variable for specific information on how it is used.
$eref.title: visualVariable

___field1.description: String value specifying the first field used to render matching values.

___styleName.description: A registered web style name. Can not be used in conjunction with styleUrl.
